oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Magnetostructural transition in Ce(Fe(0.975)Ga(0.025))(2) compound
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: HALDAR, A
SINGH, NK
MUDRYK, Y
NAYAK, AK
SURESH, KG
NIGAM, AK
PECHARSKY, VK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: manganites
mn
magnetization
avalanche
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The magnetic and magnetostructural properties of the polycrystalline Ce(Fe(0.975)Ga(0.025))(2) have been investigated as a function of temperature and magnetic field. In Ce(Fe(0.975)Ga(0.025))(2) the magnetic transition from antiferromagnetic (AFM) to ferromagnetic (FM) state is accompanied by a structural transformation from rhombohedral to cubic structure. Phase coexistence is present during both the temperature and field driven transformations from AFM to FM phase. (C) 2010 American Institute of Physics. [doi:10.1063/1.3365064]
